intro: Sisymbrium erosum, commonly known as hoary cabbages, is an annual flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes other cruciferous plants like mustard and cabbage. The plant is characterized by its hairy, grayish stems and pinnately lobed leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Its small, yellow flowers are arranged in clusters and bloom in late spring to early summer. Sisymbrium erosum is often found in disturbed soils and can thrive in a variety of habitats, including meadows and roadsides.
